question: Modern air brake systems combine three different systems. These systems are the service, parking, and ___ systems.
options: Emergency
Foot
Drum

question: The driver must see a warning before air pressure in the service tanks falls below ___ psi.
The brake pedal in an air brake system:
options: Controls the speed of the air compressor
Always needs to be held halfway during normal driving
Controls the air pressure applied to the brakes

question: Air braking takes more time than hydraulic braking because air:
options: Brakes use different brake drums
Takes more time to flow through the lines than hydraulic fluid
Is always leaking through the air line fittings

question: If your vehicle has an alcohol evaporator, its purpose is to:
options: Rid the wet tank of alcohol that condenses at the bottom
Eliminate the need for daily tank draining
Reduce the risk of ice forming in air brake valves during cold weather

question: If your truck has dual parking control valves, you can use pressure from a separate tank to:
options: Release the spring emergency parking brakes to move a short distance
Apply more brake pressure if the main tank is low
Stay parked twice as long with your service air pressure

question: To check the free play of manual slack adjusters on S-cam brakes, park the vehicle:
options: On level ground with the parking brake on, then apply the service brake
On level ground, chock the wheels, and turn off the parking brake
On level ground and drain air pressure before adjusting

question: When a low air pressure warning comes on, the first thing to do is:
options: Stop and safely park the vehicle as soon as possible
Shift to the next highest gear
Open the air supply control valve

question: The air compressor governor controls:
options: When the brake chambers release pressure
Air pressure applied to the brakes
When air is pumped into the tanks

question: The braking power of spring brakes:
options: Is not affected by the condition of the service brakes
Can only be tested by trained brake service personnel
Depends on whether the service brakes are in adjustment

question: All vehicles equipped with air brakes must have:
options: A hydraulic backup system
A supply pressure gauge
An air application gauge

question: If you must make an emergency stop, you should brake in a way that:
options: Uses the full power of the brakes to lock them
Allows you to steer and keeps the vehicle in a straight line
Uses the hand brake first

question: If you don’t have automatic tank drains, how often should you drain the oil and water from compressed air tanks?
options: At the end of each day of driving
Once a week
Before each day of driving

question: The application pressure gauge shows how much air pressure you:
options: Have used during this trip
Have in the air tanks
Are applying to the brakes

question: Your brakes are fading if:
options: You must press harder on the brake pedal to control speed on a downgrade
The brake pedal feels spongy
You release the pedal and the vehicle speeds up

question: If your vehicle has an alcohol evaporator, during cold weather you should:
options: Check the alcohol level daily and refill if necessary
Change the alcohol
Clean the air filter with alcohol

question: Why should you drain water from compressed air tanks?
options: The low boiling point of water reduces braking power
Water can freeze and cause brake failure
To keep the air compressor clean

question: If the low air pressure warning comes on in a dual air brake system, you should:
options: Stop safely and fix the system before continuing
Reduce speed and test the remaining system while driving
Reduce speed and drive to the nearest repair shop

question: During normal driving, spring brakes are usually held back by:
options: Bolts or clamps
Air pressure
Spring pressure

question: In vehicles with air brakes, parking brakes should be used:
options: As little as possible
Any time the vehicle is parked
To help hold speed when going downhill

question: Emergency stab braking is when you:
options: Press hard on the brake pedal and apply the hand valve fully
Apply the hand valve for one second, then press the brake
Brake hard, release if wheels lock, then reapply when rolling again

question: A straight truck air brake system should not leak more than ___ psi per minute (engine off, brakes released):
Air loss for a straight truck (engine off, brakes on) should not exceed:
options: 3 psi in 30 seconds
3 psi in 45 seconds
3 psi in one minute

question: The supply pressure gauge shows:
options: How much air you’ve used
Pressure in the air tanks
Air going to the brake chambers

question: The brake system that applies and releases brakes when the pedal is used is the:
options: Service system
Parking system
Drum system

question: Before driving a vehicle with a dual air system, let the compressor build to at least:
options: 125 psi
60 psi
100 psi

question: Total stopping distance for air brakes is longer than for hydraulic brakes due to:
options: Perception distance
Reaction distance
Brake lag distance

question: The most common foundation brake on heavy vehicles is the:
options: Disc brake
Wedge drum brake
S-cam drum brake

question: Emergency brakes should activate automatically when pressure falls to:

options: One-way check valve
Emergency relay valve
Tractor protection valve
